article.headline: Texas St. 79, Prairie View 78
article.story: PRAIRIE VIEW, Texas (AP) -- Cameron Johnson's offensive rebound and layup with 38 seconds left lifted Texas State over Prairie View 79-78 on Thursday night. Prairie View missed two shots on its ensuing possession and Texas State's Brandon Bush got the defensive rebound. A Panthers' foul sent Texas State to the free throw line, and Prairie View got the rebound after a missed attempt. Prairie View got a final possession with 6 seconds remaining but Freddie Edo missed the desperation shot at the buzzer. Bush and Brent Benson led Texas State (5-1) with 19 points apiece. Brian Ezeh led Prairie View (2-4) with 23 points. Derek Johnson added 13 and Dorian McDaniel 12. Derek Johnson's 3-pointer with 1:28 left gave Prairie View the 77-75 lead after battling back from a 43-34 halftime deficit. Texas State shot 47 percent from the field for the game to Prairie View's 48 percent.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
